summary: This document is a series of forwarded emails from whistleblower Christopher J. Dilorio to SEC officials, primarily Janey, Hoecker, and Jay, alleging extensive SEC corruption, obstruction, and facilitation of financial fraud. Dilorio claims the SEC is covering up money laundering schemes involving various shell companies, market manipulation, and abusive naked short selling, particularly by Knight Capital (NITE/VIRT), and is intentionally denying his whistleblower award claims.

persons.name: Christopher J. Dilorio
persons.context: Author of the emails, making extensive allegations of SEC corruption, obstruction, and financial fraud related to money laundering shells, Knight Capital, and other entities. He is appealing a preliminary denial of his whistleblower award.

persons.name: Janey
persons.context: Primary SEC recipient of Dilorio's emails, accused of not distributing his information, failing to produce a record for his award denial, and being part of the obstruction.

persons.name: Hoecker
persons.context: SEC official repeatedly addressed in emails, accused alongside Janey of corruption and obstruction in handling Dilorio's whistleblower claims.

persons.name: Jay
persons.context: SEC official mentioned as a recipient of emails regarding SEC rule changes and corruption allegations.

persons.name: Carl
persons.context: Referred to as 'Carl baby', an SEC official whose initial investigation of Dilorio's complaints is claimed to be not thorough.

persons.name: Jonathan Farkas
persons.context: Described as a 'prolific Bag Man' related to Michael Farkas and allegedly involved with Trump fundraising and money laundering shells like Skyway.

persons.name: Michael Farkas
persons.context: CEO of New Image Concepts/Blink Charging, alleged to be involved in money laundering shells and linked to Skyway fraud. Brother of Jonathan Farkas.

persons.name: Jaclin
persons.context: Central figure in alleged 'shell factory' money laundering operations, linked to multiple companies like PRComplete/YESDtc, New Image Concepts/BLNK, and others.

persons.name: Justin Keener
persons.context: Alleged 'Bag Man' associated with JMJ, involved in money laundering shells, barred by FINRA as a 'Bad Actor', and linked to Blink Charging.

persons.name: Joshie Sason
persons.context: Linked to Hanover/Magna and multiple shell companies (CGFIA, IMDS, NewLead, FreeSeas, PRTH). Subject of an SEC complaint regarding bogus notes, which Dilorio claims is based on his information.

persons.name: Barry Honig
persons.context: Mentioned in connection with Jaclin money laundering shells and SEC actions (Frost, Honig, Alpha, Stetson et al.).

persons.name: Oleg Firer
persons.context: Described as 'His Eminence' and a 'prolific Bag Man'. Incorporated Acies Corp. and linked to Allied Wallet and WireCard fraud.

persons.name: Bill Scigliano
persons.context: Chairman of the Board at companies linked to Jaclin shells; was also a Director at Oleg Firer's Acies Corp.

persons.name: Engel
persons.context: Described as a 'Milken/Drexel flunkie' on the Blink Charging (BLNK) Board of Directors, linking the company to past financial fraud.

persons.name: Jonathan New
persons.context: Former CFO of Net Element (NETE), later CFO at Blink Charging (BLNK), linked to money laundering allegations.

persons.name: Clayton
persons.context: SEC Chairman accused of not disclosing conflicts of interest related to Sullivan & Cromwell, Jared Fishman, and Knight Capital (NITE). Dilorio demands he step down.

persons.name: Jared Fishman
persons.context: Sullivan & Cromwell colleague of Chair Clayton, accused of playing a key role in keeping Knight Capital (NITE/VIRT) operational.

persons.name: Ajay Tandon
persons.context: Co-founded SeeThroughEquity, LLC, which was subject to an SEC complaint for pump-and-dump schemes involving Net Element (NETE).

persons.name: Amit Tandon
persons.context: Co-founded SeeThroughEquity, LLC, which was subject to an SEC complaint for pump-and-dump schemes involving Net Element (NETE).

persons.name: McCann
persons.context: Mentioned in a Reuters article about UBS brokerage's ties to Blackstone.

connections.description: Dilorio is a whistleblower repeatedly sending allegations and appeals to SEC official Janey, who he accuses of obstruction and failing to act on his information.
Both are SEC officials addressed together in Dilorio's emails regarding the handling of his whistleblower claims and alleged corruption.
Implied to be brothers, both described as 'Bag Men' involved in financial fraud and money laundering shells.
Both are alleged to be involved in money laundering shell operations, with Keener linked to Jaclin's shell company New Image Concepts/Blink Charging.
Both are mentioned in the context of money laundering shells and SEC complaints.
Scigliano was a Director at Firer's company, Acies Corp., linking them in alleged financial schemes.
Both are associated with Sullivan & Cromwell; Fishman is accused of helping keep Knight Capital (NITE) running, a conflict Clayton allegedly didn't disclose.
Both are described as 'Bag Men' involved in similar schemes of creating and using shell companies for money laundering and fraud.
Brothers who co-founded SeeThroughEquity, LLC, implicated in pump-and-dump schemes for Net Element (NETE).

events.title: Blink Charging Grant Announcement
events.description: Blink Charging (BLNK) awarded a grant from Virginia Clean Cities, causing stock to rise 27% on high volume, but allegedly without filing a required SEC 8-K form.

events.title: Knight Capital Trading Glitch
events.description: A trading glitch at Knight Capital Group caused its stock to collapse from over $10.30 to nearly $2.50. Blackstone had considered buying Knight Capital before this event.

events.title: SEC Charges UBS with AML Violations
events.description: SEC settled charges against UBS Financial Services Inc. for failing to report suspicious transactions, resulting in a $5 million civil penalty and a separate $10 million payment to the U.S. Treasury.

events.title: SEC Complaint Against SeeThroughEquity
events.description: SEC filed a complaint against SeeThroughEquity, LLC and its founders Ajay and Amit Tandon for engaging in pump-and-dump schemes, including promoting Net Element (NETE) in 2018.

events.title: SEC Jaclin Shell Factory Complaint
events.description: SEC filed a complaint against Jaclin et al. for operating a 'shell factory' involving companies like New Image Concepts (later Blink Charging).

events.title: FINRA Bars Justin Keener
events.description: FINRA barred Justin Keener/JMJ as a 'Bad Actor' for failing to comply with information requests related to anti-money laundering investigations.

events.title: Dilorio's Appeal and Allegations
events.description: Christopher Dilorio sends emails appealing the SEC's preliminary denial of his whistleblower award, alleging ongoing SEC corruption, Knight Capital's insolvency due to naked shorting, and demanding immediate actions like shutting down the OTC market.

keyFacts: Christopher J. Dilorio, a whistleblower, alleges the SEC is engaged in systematic corruption, obstructing investigations into money laundering shells and market manipulation to protect entities like Knight Capital (NITE/VIRT).

Dilorio claims his extensive whistleblower tips, filed as TCRs, formed the basis for several SEC complaints (e.g., against Sason, Jaclin, SeeThroughEquity), but the SEC is denying his award and covering up larger crimes.

The document links numerous individuals (Jaclin, Justin Keener, Jonathan & Michael Farkas, Oleg Firer, Joshie Sason) to a network of shell companies (Blink Charging, Net Element, New Image Concepts) used for money laundering and pump-and-dump schemes.
Dilorio accuses SEC Chair Clayton of undisclosed conflicts of interest related to his former firm Sullivan & Cromwell and attorney Jared Fishman, who allegedly helped keep Knight Capital operational.

The whistleblower asserts that mechanisms like the DTCC's Obligation Warehouse (OW) are used illegally to hide abusive naked short selling by Knight Capital, circumventing Reg SHO rules and continuing to pose a risk to the public.
